question.text: Given below is a plant and two properties of it. Which of these options is INCORRECT?

options.text: Cucumber:  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  Stem tendrils develop from axillary buds  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  The margin of thalamus grows upward enclosing the ovary completely and getting fused with it, the other parts of flower arise above the ovary

Rose:  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  Ovary is half inferior  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  Gynoecium is polycarpellary and apocarpous

Lemon:  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  Stamens are polyadelphous  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>  Placenta is axial and the ovules are attached to it in a multilocular ovary

Castor: <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> The seed has one cotyledon <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> The seed has endosperm

solution.text: Castor is a dicot plant with two cotyledons and endosperm in retained in its seed. Cucumber has stem tendrils that develop from axillary buds and are slender and spirally coiled helping it to climb. It has an epigynous flower with an inferior ovary. Rose has a perigynous flower with half an inferior ovary. It has many free carpels. Thus, its gynoecium is polycarpellary and apocarpous. In lemon, there are many stamens whose filaments are fused together to form more than two bundles. Lemons have axile placentation in which the placenta is axial and the ovules are attached to it in a multilocular ovary.
